Thanks for your help!
I have now made my own local isValid() m=
ethod as you suggested to bypass
this problem,
but IMHO the isValid() metho=
d should be made public again in the ARCReader
class.

Hey S=F8ren:

Apoloize for breaking your tes=
t.  Below is excerpt from the commit
message that removed isValid.

revisio=
n 1.48
date: 2005/07/16 01:47:59;  author: stack-sf;  state: Exp;  lines: +=
8 -7
...
* src/java/org/archive/io/arc/ARCReader.java
    Close down method=
s not used: validate(int), isValid, getCurrentRecord.

We weren't using it =
and it seemed like it better belonged as a unit test
anyways.

I can put ba=
ck the isValid if you'd like -- just ask -- or you could
just reformat your=
 test so it does what isValid does:

    protected boolean isValid() {
    =
    boolean valid =3D false;
        try {
            validate();
        =
    valid =3D true;
        } catch(Exception e) {
            // File is n=
ot valid if exception thrown parsing.
            valid =3D false;
        =
}

        return valid;
    }

Have your test let out the exception?

Your=
s,
St.Ack




svc@... wrote:

> Dear all.
> The current Heritrix 1.5.1 no=
w breaks one of our unit-tests, that
> tests for
> validity of an ARC-file:=

>
> ARCReader ar =3D ARCReaderFactory.get(anArc):
> assertTrue("ARC-file i=
s invalid", ar.isValid() );
>
> The method isValid() is now protected, so w=
e can no longer validate the
> ARC-file in this manner.
> So, what is the s=
uggested method to validate ARC-files?
>
